outputs.output_descr: The National Protected Area System of Ukraine is composed of more than 7,000 protected areas covering 5.6% of the national territory. A considerable gap between financial needs of the protected areas and available funds leads to persistent threat to the biodiversity. The objective of the project is to enhance the financial sustainability and strengthen institutional capacity of the protected areas system in Ukraine. The normative solution will be pursued through the systematic emplacement of ear marked revenue capture mechanisms to complement budgetary subventions to the protected areas system, and through improvements to its governance that ensure that revenue streams are employed efficiently so that impact is optimized per unit of investment.

project_descr: Strengthening Governance and Financial Sustainability of the National Protected Area System in Ukraine
